newsitem.title: USA: LaBarge wins $3.7 mln space shuttle contract.
newsitem.headline: LaBarge wins $3.7 mln space shuttle contract.

text.p: LaBarge Inc said Thursday it has been awarded a $3.7 million contract to supply cable assemblies used in NASA's space shuttle program.
The contract was awarded by USBI Co, a subsidiary of United Technologies Corp and part of Pratt & Whitney's space propulsion operations.
Under the four year contract, LaBarge said it will continue to produce cable assemblies for the space shuttle's solid rocket boosters. LaBarge will build the cables at its plant in Joplin, Mo.
LaBarge has provided USBI with cables and other products for the shuttle since 1970.
Shares of LaBarge were up 1/8 to 6-1/8.
